com.bigdata.btree

Class TestIndexSegmentWithBloomFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • junit.framework.TestCase2
          • com.bigdata.btree.AbstractBTreeTestCase
            • com.bigdata.btree.TestIndexSegmentWithBloomFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class TestIndexSegmentWithBloomFilter
extends AbstractBTreeTestCase
    Test build trees on the journal, evicts them into an IndexSegment, and then compares the performance and correctness of index point tests with and without the use of the bloom filter.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

    • Method Detail

      • getProperties

        public Properties getProperties()
        Description copied from class: TestCase2
        Reads in the configuration properties for the test from a variety of resources and returns a properties hierarchy. If a property name is not bound at the top-level of the returned Properties object, then the lower levels of the hierarchy are recursively searched.

        The hierarchy is constructed from the following properties files in the following order. The first property file in this list corresponds to the top of the property hierarchy. The last property file in this list corresponds to the bottom of the property hierarchy. The property resources are:

        1. The System properties specified using the -D argument on the command line.
        2. ${user.home}/build.properties. ${user.home} is the value of the Java system environment variable named "user.home" and corresponds to the user home directory. A warning is logged if this properties file does not exist. Note: The JUnit UI can wind up with a different value for this property than when you execute tests without the UI. It is an error if the properties file exists but can not be read.
        3. {class}.properties, where {class} is the class name reported by Java reflection, is loaded iff it is found.
        4. {class} is repeatedly truncated by dropping the last package name component to generate a package name. If a properties file named "test.properties" exists in that package then those properties are loaded.
        Overrides:
        getProperties in class TestCase2
        Returns:
        A Properties object that supplies bindings for property names according to the described hierarchy among property resources. The returned Properties is NOT cached. TODO This does not handle the recursive truncation of the class name to search for "test.properties" yet.

      • getBTree

        public BTree getBTree(int branchingFactor,
             BloomFilterFactory bloomFilterFactory)
        Return a btree backed by a journal with the indicated branching factor. The serializer requires that values in leaves are SimpleEntry objects.
        Parameters:
        branchingFactor - The branching factor.
        Returns:
        The btree.

      • test_randomDenseKeys

        public void test_randomDenseKeys()
                          throws Exception
        A stress test for building IndexSegments. A variety of BTrees are built from dense random keys in [1:n] using a variety of branching factors. For each BTree, a variety of IndexSegments are built using a variety of output branching factors. For each IndexSegment, we then compare it against its source BTree for the same total ordering.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • test_randomSparseKeys

        public void test_randomSparseKeys()
                           throws Exception
        A stress test for building IndexSegments. A variety of BTrees are built from spase random keys using a variety of branching factors. For each BTree, a variety of IndexSegments are built using a variety of output branching factors. For each IndexSegment, we then compare it against its source BTree for the same total ordering.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • test_rootLeaf

        public void test_rootLeaf()
                   throws Exception
        Test when the input tree is a root leaf with three values. The output tree will also be a root leaf.
        Throws:
        IOException
        Exception

      • doBuildIndexSegmentAndCompare

        public void doBuildIndexSegmentAndCompare(BTree btree)
                                   throws Exception
        Test helper builds an index segment from the btree using several different branching factors and each time compares the resulting total ordering to the original btree.
        Parameters:
        btree - The source btree.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • doBloomFilterTest

        protected void doBloomFilterTest(String label,
                     IBloomFilter bloomFilter,
                     byte[][] keys)
        Test the bloom filter for false negatives given the ground truth set of keys. if it reports that a key was not in the bloom filter then that is a false negative. bloom filters are not supposed to have false negative.
        Parameters:
        keys - The ground truth keys that were inserted into the bloom filter.
